metadata.Title: CVE-2022-46149 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.Description: Cap'n Proto is a data interchange format and remote procedure call (RPC)system. Cap'n Proro prior to versions 0.7.1, 0.8.1, 0.9.2, and 0.10.3, aswell as versions of Cap'n Proto's Rust implementation prior to 0.13.7,0.14.11, and 0.15.2 are vulnerable to out-of-bounds read due to logic errorhandling list-of-list. This issue may lead someone to remotely segfault apeer by sending it a malicious message, if the victim performs certainactions on a list-of-pointer type. Exfiltration of memory is possible ifthe victim performs additional certain actions on a list-of-pointer type.To be vulnerable, an application must perform a specific sequence ofactions, described in the GitHub Security Advisory. The bug is present ininlined code, therefore the fix will require rebuilding dependentapplications. Cap'n Proto has C++ fixes available in versions 0.7.1, 0.8.1,0.9.2, and 0.10.3. The `capnp` Rust crate has fixes available in versions0.13.7, 0.14.11, and 0.15.2.

criterions.comment: capnproto: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
